trans-unit.source: Exposes <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> types to UI Automation.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> class.
The <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Creates a <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>.
This <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer> remains in memory until the associated <xref:System.Windows.ContentElement> is destroyed.

The same instance of the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer> is returned from subsequent calls to this method and to calls to <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer.FromElement%2A>.
The type of the peer is determined by the <xref:System.Windows.UIElement.OnCreateAutomationPeer%2A> virtual callback.
If <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkContentElement> does not implement the callback, no <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer> is created and this method returns `null`.
The <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> for the specified <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>, or `null` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> has not been created by the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer.CreatePeerForElement(System.Windows.ContentElement)"></xref> method.
Gets the accelerator key for the element associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAcceleratorKey"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref> string.
Gets the access key for the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAccessKey"></xref>.
The access key for this <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref>.
Gets the control type for the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationControlType"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationControlType.Custom"></xref> enumeration value.

Gets the string that uniquely identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetAutomationId"></xref>.

The value of the automation identifier is the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.AutomationProperties.AutomationId%2A> property, and if that isn't set, it's the <xref:System.Windows.FrameworkElement.Name%2A> property.
A string containing the automation identifier.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Rect"></xref> representing the bounding rectangle of the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetBoundingRectangle"></xref>.
The bounding rectangle.

Gets the collection of child elements of the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetChildren"></xref>.
The collection of child elements.
Gets the name of the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClassName"></xref>.
An <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref> string.

Gets a <xref href="System.Windows.Point"></xref> that represents the clickable space that is on the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetClickablePoint"></xref>.

For example, if the element is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button>, the clickable point is any point that is within the visible client area of the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> that would result in issuing the command that the button represents, when the user clicks the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Button> by using the mouse.
The point that represents the clickable space that is on the element.

Gets the string that describes the functionality of the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetHelpText"></xref>.
The string that is returned generally is the same text that is provided in the tooltip for the control.

The string that describes the functionality of the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.

Gets a string that conveys the visual status of the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemStatus"></xref>.
For example, the status of a messenger contact could be "Busy" or "Online".
A string containing the status.

Gets a human-readable string that contains the type of the item that the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> represents.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetItemType"></xref>.
Examples are "Mail Message", "Contact", and "Document".
The string that contains the item type.

Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer"></xref> for the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Label"></xref> that is targeted to the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy"></xref>.

For example, if the element is a <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox> control, the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetLabeledBy%2A> method could get the <xref:System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer> for the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.Label> that is associated with the <xref:System.Windows.Controls.ComboBox>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.LabelAutomationPeer"></xref> for the element that is targeted by the <xref href="System.Windows.Controls.Label"></xref>.
Gets the text label of the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetName"></xref>.
The name property can be thought of as the string of text that a user would use to explain which control is being referred to.

It is important to have a textual representation for all controls in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gui](~/includes/tlasharptla-gui-md.md)] so that you can programmatically refer to the control in a localized manner.
The string that contains the label.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is laid out in a specific direction.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.GetOrientation"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationOrientation.None"></xref> enumeration value.
Gets the control pattern for the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
One of the enumeration values.
An object that implements the interface if patternInterface is ; otherwise, `null`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> currently has keyboard input focus.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.HasKeyboardFocus"></xref>.
`true` if the element has keyboard input focus; otherwise, `false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is an element that contains data that is presented to the user.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsContentElement"></xref>.
`false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is something that the end user would understand as being interactive or as contributing to the logical structure of the control in the [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_gui](~/includes/tla2sharptla-gui-md.md)].
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsControlElement"></xref>.
`false`.
Gets a value that indicates whether this automation peer can receive and send events to the associated element.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsEnabled"></xref>.
`true` if the automation peer can receive and send events; otherwise, `false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> can accept keyboard focus.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsKeyboardFocusable"></xref>.
`false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is off of the screen.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsOffscreen"></xref>.
This property does not indicate whether the element is visible.
In some circumstances, an element can be on the screen but still not be visible, for example if the element is obscured by other elements.
In this case the method would return `false`.
`true` if the element is not on the screen; otherwise, `false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> contains protected content.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsPassword"></xref>.
`false`.

Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref> is required to be filled out on a form.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.IsRequiredForForm"></xref>.
`false`.
Gets the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Sets the keyboard input focus on the <xref href="System.Windows.ContentElement"></xref> that is associated with this <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.ContentElementAutomationPeer"></xref>.
Called by <xref href="System.Windows.Automation.Peers.AutomationPeer.SetFocus"></xref>.
